title: Fix agentic run scripts to resolve relative output paths
description: run_swebench_multilingual.sh and run_swebench_live_multilang.sh write log files relative to WORKDIR; when output paths are passed relative to repo root, tee fails with 'No such file or directory'. Resolve output paths to absolute (repo-root-based) before cd to WORKDIR so logs/metadata go where expected.

title: Investigate agent format-error loop (tool-call config mismatch)
description:
Investigate agent FormatError loop (tool-call config mismatch).

Current state:
- mini-swe-agent submodule now at commit 2242b03 (adds LitellmModel tool-call parsing + tools=[bash]).
- JSON-safe live/final trajectory serialization and FormatError raw assistant capture already in fork.
- Config template aligns with mini-swe-agent default single-step submission: echo COMPLETE_TASK_AND_SUBMIT_FINAL_OUTPUT && git diff --cached.

Next steps (run in work/swebench/mini-swe-agent):
1) Re-run default-config test with litellm + vLLM to see if tool-call formatting still fails.
2) If FormatError persists, capture raw assistant output from trajectories to confirm prompt mismatch.
3) Retry Qwen3 run once FormatError loop is resolved.
4) Update docs/CURRENT_STATUS.md with findings and unblock swebench-eval-6ij.

Notes:
- Repo tests: python -m unittest discover -s tests -v passing.
notes: Deferred while Qwen3 run active; current trajectories show no missing tool calls on active instance.
close_reason: Resolved: tool-call FormatError loop fixed; no longer blocking runs.

title: Complete memory investigation controlled tests
description:
Phase 3.4 in ralph/plans/EXECUTION_PLAN.md and logs/memory-investigation.md. Goal: determine safe UMA memory envelope and whether cache flush mitigations work before any new model runs.

Current state (2026-02-02): tests not started. No long-running jobs active. Prior nohup unittest failed because `python` not on PATH; use `python3`.

Required steps:
- Start memory monitor before each test: `./scripts/monitor_memory.sh` (capture log path in logs/memory-investigation.md).
- Start vLLM: `./scripts/agentic/serve_vllm_model.sh deepseek` (or qwen3 if preferred; keep settings default unless changing plan/spec).
- Run controlled slices with mini-swe-agent (workers=1):
  - 1 instance: `mini-extra swebench --config configs/deepseek-livesweagent.yaml --subset "SWE-bench-Live/MultiLang" --split c --slice 0:1 --workers 1 --output logs/swebench-live-multilang/deepseek/c`
  - 2 instances: `... --slice 0:2 ...`
  - 5 instances: `... --slice 0:5 ...`
- After each run, record peak RAM/swap from monitor logs and summarize in logs/memory-investigation.md.
- Compare with vanilla evaluation harness:
  `cd /home/sailorjoe6/work/swebench/SWE-bench-Live && python3 -m evaluation.evaluation --dataset SWE-bench-Live/MultiLang --split c --platform linux --patch_dir <preds.json> --output_dir <eval_dir> --workers 1 --overwrite 0`
- UMA cache flush test: `echo 3 | sudo tee /proc/sys/vm/drop_caches > /dev/null` and record pre/post available RAM.
- Update ralph/plans/EXECUTION_PLAN.md and ralph/plans/SPECIFICATION.md with any new limits/mitigations discovered.
- Stop vLLM container when done: `./scripts/agentic/stop_vllm_model.sh deepseek`.

Notes:
- Use `python3` everywhere (no `python` in PATH).
- Keep workers=1 until memory limits confirmed.
notes: Previous note about a running nohup unittest was incorrect. The nohup command failed immediately because `python` is not on PATH; see logs/unittest-nohup.out ("nohup: failed to run command 'python': No such file or directory"). No long-running unittest is currently running. If tests are still needed, rerun with `python3 -m unittest discover -s tests -v` (optionally under nohup) and monitor logs/unittest-nohup.out for progress. Memory investigation steps are still pending after tests.
close_reason: Memory investigation complete; stable with max-model-len 262144, prefer gpu-memory-utilization 0.80 per operator observations. Documentation updated.

title: Stop sequences cause malformed tool-call JSON with Qwen3
description:
Enabling model_kwargs.stop in qwen3-livesweagent.yaml causes malformed tool-call JSON (concatenated fragments) and FormatError loops with Qwen3.

Repro:
1) In configs/qwen3-livesweagent.yaml set model_kwargs.stop to </files>, </output>, </instructions>, </instructions>/n.
2) Run mini-extra swebench with Qwen3 vLLM (hosted_vllm/Qwen/Qwen3-Coder-30B-A3B-Instruct-FP8).
3) Observe tool_call args like {"command": "ls -la""{"command": "ls -la"}"} in traj; parse_error + FormatError loop.

Mitigation: keep stop sequences commented out in template/configs. Template updated to match working config.

Expected: valid tool-call JSON. Actual: malformed JSON + repeated FormatError.
notes: Confirmed: enabling model_kwargs.stop causes malformed tool-call JSON with Qwen3; leaving stop sequences commented out. Template updated to match working config.

title: Fix failing repo tests (litellm streaming + instance template)
description:
Repo tests failing after recent config/toolcall changes.

Failures:
- tests/test_litellm_streaming.py: test_query_rejects_unknown_tool + test_query_requires_tool_calls expect FormatError but not raised; test_query_returns_actions_and_extra missing extra['actions'].
- tests/test_swebench_configs.py: test_instance_template_has_two_step_submission expects 'git add -A' in instance_template, missing in current template.

Repro:
source /home/sailorjoe6/work/swebench/.venv/bin/activate
python -m unittest discover -s tests -v

Likely causes:
- Contract change in mini-swe-agent tool-call handling or streaming response structure.
- Config template edits removed staging instructions.

Goal:
- Update code/tests/templates so tests pass while preserving current tool-call behavior.

title: Generate agentic evaluation final report

- Any model/runtime limitations from run logs.

Report sections (per spec):
- Environment details (container image, dataset shas, commit hashes).
- Metrics per model per dataset.
- Failures/limitations and mitigation steps.

If missing metrics, re-run pipeline evaluation with:
- `./scripts/agentic/pipeline_swebench.sh --suite multilingual --model <model> --workers 1 --loop 0`
- `./scripts/agentic/pipeline_swebench.sh --suite live-multilang --model <model> --workers 1 --loop 0`

title: Add LiteLLM response streaming with usage fallback
description:
Branch 3 of plan (submodule). Must be created in work/swebench/mini-swe-agent, stacked on sailorjoe/live-trajectory-streaming.

Goal: add LiteLLM response streaming with usage fallback.
- Extend LitellmModelConfig: use_streaming (env MSWEA_USE_STREAMING, default false) and stream_include_usage (env MSWEA_STREAM_INCLUDE_USAGE, default true).
- In LitellmModel._query(), when use_streaming=true: call litellm.completion(..., stream=True) with tools preserved.
- Reconstruct a ModelResponse from stream chunks (content/tool_calls/usage).
- If streamed usage missing/invalid, fall back to non-streaming completion to preserve cost tracking.
- Non-streaming path unchanged when use_streaming=false.
- Add tests for streaming reconstruction + usage fallback (likely via fake stream chunks).

Prereqs/notes:
- Source venv before tests: source ../.venv/bin/activate (from submodule).
- Full suite passes currently: python -m pytest -q (480 passed, 32 skipped). Use long timeout.
- Completion gate: tests pass, then commit and push the submodule branch.

title: swebench-single: output file flag is ignored and live JSONL not supported
description:
swebench-single does not persist trajectories. The -o/--output option is defined but never used (no file is written). It also never sets a live JSONL trajectory path (no *.traj.jsonl stream), so tailing live runs does not work for swebench-single.

Subtasks:
1) Fix swebench-single to actually write the -o/--output trajectory (prepare upstream PR).
2) Add live JSONL streaming support for swebench-single on the appropriate branch (trajectory-streaming not yet accepted upstream).

title: Update litellm streaming tests for mini-swe-agent v2
description: Update tests/test_litellm_streaming.py for mini-swe-agent v2. v2 removed streaming config and text-based parsing: LitellmModelConfig has no use_streaming or env var MSWEA_USE_STREAMING; LitellmModel has no _reconstruct_response_from_stream; LitellmModel.query always calls litellm.completion(..., tools=[BASH_TOOL]) and parses tool_calls via _parse_actions (parse_toolcall_actions). tool_calls can be None -> [] (ok), unknown tool -> FormatError. Update tests to match tool-calling behavior; likely drop streaming/non-streaming/env-var checks and replace with assertions around query response shape (content + extra.response/actions) using a stubbed litellm.completion or a lightweight fake response object. Keep vLLM integration only if still useful. Re-run: source work/swebench/.venv/bin/activate; python -m unittest discover -s tests -v.

title: Implement stream guard circuit breaker for streaming outputs
description:
Branch 4 of plan (submodule). Must be created in work/swebench/mini-swe-agent, stacked on sailorjoe/llm-response-streaming.

Goal: stream guard circuit breaker for pathological closing-tag repetition during streaming.
- Extend LitellmModelConfig: stream_guard_enabled (env MSWEA_STREAM_GUARD_ENABLED, default false), stream_guard_window (env MSWEA_STREAM_GUARD_WINDOW, default 8192), stream_guard_tag_threshold (env MSWEA_STREAM_GUARD_TAG_THRESHOLD, default 50).
- In streaming path, detect repeated closing tags within rolling window; truncate safely and log warning.
- Add tests for guard behavior (pathological repetition triggers truncation + warning; non-pathological content unaffected).

Prereqs/notes:
- Source venv before tests: source ../.venv/bin/activate (from submodule).
- Full suite currently passes on live-trajectory branch; use long timeout for full pytest.
- Completion gate: tests pass, then commit and push the submodule branch.

title: Run GPT-OSS agentic evals (multilingual + live-multilang)
description: Run GPT-OSS vLLM, execute multilingual + live-multilang agentic runs via wrapper scripts, ensure preds.json complete, stop vLLM, record metrics.

title: Wrapper scripts should enforce amd64 emulation preflight
description: Spec requires binfmt install + DOCKER_DEFAULT_PLATFORM=linux/amd64 verification before runs. run_swebench_multilingual.sh / run_swebench_live_multilang.sh do not enforce this, allowing non-compliant launches.

title: Create core-fix branch off main and apply core commit
description: Create new core-fix branch off origin/main (e.g. sailorjoe/core-trajectory-debug) in work/swebench/mini-swe-agent and cherry-pick core commit 252febe. Run full test suite after commit.
